content:
Why PlayStation?
PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.
PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.
The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.Credit Manager
San Mateo, CA 
The Credit Manager is responsible for the overall credit management activities and initiatives of Sony Interactive Entertainment LLC (or SIE or PlayStation), including the enforcement of the Company’s Credit Policies, Procedures and Practices. The role performs the credit evaluation and risk assessment of current and new customers, recommends the appropriate credit lines, and provide sound credit decisions to management. The position is a high visibility role and customer-facing, dealing directly with finance executives of multiple customer channels and acting as the intermediary between clients and SIE decision-makers. The Credit Manager supports the SIE Sales team in terms of maximizing sales while identifying and mitigating the risks of doing business with customers. This individual articulates the Company’s Credit Policies during business discussions and provides clear direction and/or guidance as it relates to SIE’s credit procedures & practices.
Responsibilities:

Manages the credit review process and evaluation of customers’ credit worthiness
Responsible for identifying & assessing the credit risks and recommending the appropriate credit limits for HQ approval
Articulates comprehensive credit analysis and findings to management/HQ
Enforces credit guidelines as outlined in the Global Finance Policies & Procedures and ensures compliance to SOX narratives
Develops credit scoring models and analytics to identify and assess credit risks
Works with Sales & Operations in forecasting High AR and peak sales periods
Supports Treasury initiatives and globalization efforts, particularly in establishing standard credit & control practices
Monitors relevant industry developments and market news that may have an impact on the viability of SIE’s customer portfolio, such as potential bankruptcy filings, geo-political & economic events, etc.
Acts as the SME in leading discussions on credit-related topics
Represents SIE during customer visits and industry meetings & conferences (Riemer, CRF, NACM, etc.)
Assists and supports the OTC team in achieving departmental goals and KPIs, including active involvement in various collection & reconciliation work-outs with customers
Performs various departmental ad hoc projects and assignments

Qualifications:

5+ years experience in credit management, preferably in the video games and/or home entertainment industry
Extensive knowledge in ratio & financial analysis and ability to verbally interpret the numbers in a cohesive & concise manner
Possesses strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication & presentation skills, written and verbal
Requires a collaborative & open communication style to facilitate better business relationships with both internal & external partners
Solid understanding of general credit and lending procedures, familiarity with SOX, Business and Bankruptcy laws and Credit Insurance procedure
Proficient in PowerPoint, Excel, or other spreadsheet software programs
S/4Hana and Business Objects experience
Experience managing a BPO team a plus
BS in Accounting, Economics, Banking, and Finance or relevant field preferred but not required

Voluntary Self-Identification

Our vision at PlayStation is to bring out the best in our global team members by creating a sense of belonging, being a place where they can grow, and ensuring everyone feels valued, heard, and supported so we can push the boundaries of play. That vision begins our candidates, and we are working to better understand the diversity of our candidate population.  
 
This data will also be aggregated and sent to the government for reporting purposes. Please know that the completion of this form is entirely voluntary. Your personally identifiable information (name, address, etc) will not be considered in the hiring process or thereafter. Any information that you choose to provide will be recorded and maintained in a confidential file for XX time.

 

Protected Veteran

You are a “protected veteran” under United States law if any of the following apply to you:

  • Disabled Veteran: a veteran of the U.S. military who is entitled to compensation (or who would be entitled to compensation if not for the receipt of military retired pay) under the administration of the Secretary of Veterans Affairs and/or a person who was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability. 
  • Recently Separated Veteran: a veteran who has discharged or released from active duty in the U.S. military within the last three years.
  • Armed Forces Service Medal Veteran: a veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, participated in a U.S. military operation for which an Armed Forces Service Medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985.

 

Disability

Under U.S. law, you are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition.

Identifying yourself as an individual with a disability is voluntary, and we hope that you will choose to do so. Your answer will be maintained confidentially and will not be seen by selecting officials or anyone else involved in making personnel decisions, nor will it be shared with our accommodations team . Completing the form will not negatively impact you in any way, regardless of whether you have self-identified in the past.
